intro: Odontarrhena stipitata, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows up to 1 meter in height, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, which is a characteristic shared with other members of the Apocynaceae family. Odontarrhena stipitata is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
